column5: Hi All,  Aint been out nearly as much as usual this past month....wife lost her job, got recalled...interviews, lost our full-time sitter.....windows and doors to fix...etc....etc...etc.  Finally got some days in this week.     FIRST EVENING JACK AND ME WENT SHORE FISHING UP THE ROAD WHILE MUM WAS DOING NIGHT SHIFT                        WE GOT 2 SMALLER ONES AND HAD A NICE SUPPER TOGETHER, HE IS A GREAT HELPER AND LOVES GUTTING THE FISH.              NEXT EVENING MUM WAS WORKING AGAIN SO WE TRIED FROM SHORE IN FRONT OF THE HOUSE                      DID NOT CATCH A THING.....BUT IT WAS GREAT FUN ANYWAY. WE WATCHED THE SUN GO DOWN TOGETHER AND ROASTED SOME MARSHMALLOWS TO EASE THE SKUNKY FEELING                     A COUPLE OF DAYS LATER MY BUDDY AND ME HEADED OUT FOR WALLEYE, PICKED OFF A FEW BIRDS ON THE WAY IN.             WAS A BEAUTIFUL FALL DAY, COMPLETE WITH BLUSTERY WINDS AND SHOWERS, BUT MAINLY SUNNY.                 THE FISH WERE DEFINITELY HUNGRY......BUT SMALL               BUT WE GOT SOME NICE KEEPER SIZE AND A COUPLE OF 25"ERS+             NEXT AFTERNOON WHILE MUM AND JACK NAPPED I SNUCK OUT LOCALLY TO SEE IF THE TROUT WERE PLAYING......THEY WERE.           ALSO MANAGED 2 30"ER WALLEYE                     WATCHED ANOTHER AWESOME SUNSET AS I STRAPPED THE BOAT TO THE TRAILER ON THE WAY OUT.            SOME VIDEO OF THE ADVENTURES  <iframe width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/YrDIszNcvgo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>          <iframe width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/JW8IGoGUAo4" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>      Fish all came from 30' - 48' FOW on both days out in the boat on 2 different lakes.   Jigs and minnows (mostly 4 - 6" suckers/dace minnows) were the bait and tackle, straight jigging the presentation, good use of electronics helped locate them.   1st day was blustery wind and rain, next day was mostly sunny....wind was average 10kmh both days. Water temps were mid 50s at the surface.     tight lines all!
Great post, that is some pretty cool scenery and game  4-6" minnows wow!.. I'm buying the wrong size minnows HAHA!
Looked like another walleye in its mouth to me lol  Nice fish

The way my day (and yesterday) have been going, this report is just what I needed. Thanks Simon! Great pics and videos as per usual. Being a non hunter and having no idea how to clean a bird, it was cool to see the cleaning up of that one.
Awesome Simon!!!!  yeppers, walleye love those hyyyuge minnows!
Beautiful report Simon.  You got the life man
Hey Simon:  Wondered where you'd been! Sorry to hear about the other half's income crunch, sure does hurt when that happens. Awesome shots of Jack and some real brute walters there.

Thanks for the replies lads and ladettes!           My pleasure!  I'm not a hunter either (yet)so that,that was the first time I've seen that too!      Thanks man, she got a casual position yesterday and heard from a friend that another employer was checking her references already after yesterday's interview .
Thanx for the report.  Those are some beauty wallys.  Jack is so cute.  Love the sunsets.

Awesome report, fish, pics and videos Simon   Sorry to hear about your wife's set back... never fun to get recalled    The cleaning of the bird is exactly how I do it too    Quick & easy  Great job on those enormous wallys Thanks as always for taking the time to share your adventures with us! Jacques
Wild poultry and wild trout, it doesn't get much better than that!
Sorry to hear about the recent road bumps Simon.  Keep your chin up dood and fish often.
My wife insist's on a movie at home Sunday evenings but I would trade them for a Limey post any day. If theres video well then they're just that much better. Thanks!
